isis.stitle: TSI 93-16-06 - Reposition Air Conditioning Hose From Compressor to Condenser

subjectgroup.subject: Reposition Air Conditioning Hose From Compressor to Condenser

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 9400 Models with Detroit Diesel Series 60 engines and air conditioning.

9400 Model vehicles with Detroit Diesel Series 60 engines may experience wear to the air conditioning hose that runs from the compressor to the condenser due to the center hood restraint cable rubbing against it.

Inspect the hose for excessive wear. If wear is excessive, replace the hose with one of the two listed under PARTS INFORMATION below. The new hose, or existing hose will have to be repositioned to prevent the center hood restraint cable from rubbing against it as described under SERVICE PROCEDURE below.

entry.para: Air Conditioning Hose for Vehicles Built Prior to November 30, 1992, Charged With R12 Refrigerant
Air Conditioning Hose for Vehicles Built After November 30, 1992, Charged With HFC134A Refrigerant

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: See Figure 1 for a view of the Series 60 Engine.

step1.para: Remove the cushioned clamp ( Figure 2) from the air conditioning hose.
Remove the pipe clamp ( Figure 2) from the radiator pipe.
Rotate the pipe clamp 180 degrees and re-install on the radiator pipe as illustrated in Figure 3. Loosely install the bolt and nut that secures the pipe clamp to the radiator pipe.

Rotate the cushioned clamp 180 degrees and position it around the air conditioning hose. Fasten the cushioned clamp, with the bolt, nut and lock washer removed in step 1, to the pipe clamp as illustrated in Figure 3.
Rotate the pipe clamp toward the rear of the engine (down) approximately 30 degrees ( Figure 3) and tighten the bolt and nut that secures the pipe clamp to the radiator pipe.
Tighten the bolt and nut that secure the cushioned clamp to the pipe clamp
